title: Broken code is generated with --skip-flatten

labels.name: model
labels.description: Related to swagger generate model command

body:
## Problem statement

It seems swagger version 0.14 has an issue in the server and client code generation if --skip-flatten parameter is used. It generates models but those models are not used in the responses. Instead there is an attempt to refer the models namespace but with a struct name that doesn't exist in there. There is a struct defined under that name in restapi/operations/.../directory.

After code is generated using the spec bellow take a look at the following files:
restapi/operations/object/get_objects_responses.go
restapi/operations/object/get_objects.go

The first file has the following code:
```
/*GetObjectsOK Objects

swagger:response getObjectsOK
*/
type GetObjectsOK struct {

    /*
      In: Body
    */
    Payload []*models.GetObjectsOKBodyItems0 `json:"body,omitempty"`
}
```

The second one has declaration of GetObjectsOKBodyItems0:
```
// GetObjectsOKBodyItems0 get objects o k body items0
// swagger:model GetObjectsOKBodyItems0
type GetObjectsOKBodyItems0 struct {

    // Object description.
    // Required: true
    Description *string `json:"description"`

    // Object ID
    // Read Only: true
    // Format: uuid4
    ID strfmt.UUID4 `json:"id,omitempty"`

    // Object name.
    // Read Only: true
    Name string `json:"name,omitempty"`
}
```

The models/object.go file was also created but I don't see where that package is used in the generated code. The content of the Object struct from that file basically a duplicate of GetObjectsOKBodyItems0:
```
// Object object
// swagger:model Object
type Object struct {

    // Object description.
    // Required: true
    Description *string `json:"description"`

    // Object ID
    // Read Only: true
    // Format: uuid4
    ID strfmt.UUID4 `json:"id,omitempty"`

    // Object name.
    // Read Only: true
    Name string `json:"name,omitempty"`
}
```
 
## Swagger specification
```
swagger: "2.0"
info:
  title: Test API
  description: Proof of bug Test API
  version: 2.0.0
schemes:
  - https
basePath: /
consumes:
  - application/json
produces:
  - application/json
paths:
  "/objects":
    get:
      summary: Objects
      description: Returns list of all objects
      operationId: getObjects
      tags:
        - Object
      responses:
        "200":
          description: Objects
          schema:
            type: array
            items:
              $ref: "#/definitions/Object"
        default:
          $ref: "#/responses/default"
  "/objects/{id}":
    parameters:
      - name: id
        description: Object ID.
        in: path
        required: true
        type: string
        format: uuid4
    get:
      summary: Object details
      description: Returns object identified by the provided ID.
      operationId: getObjectById
      tags:
        - Object
      responses:
        "200":
          description: Object details
          schema:
            $ref: "#/definitions/Object"
        default:
          $ref: "#/responses/default"
responses:
  default:
    description: Unexpected error
    schema:
      $ref: '#/definitions/Error'
definitions:
  Error:
    properties:
      errorCode:
        type: integer
      errorMessage:
        type: string
      moreInfo:
        type: string
  Object:
    type: object
    required:
      - description
    properties:
      id:
        type: string
        format: uuid4
        description: Object ID
        readOnly: true
      name:
        type: string
        description: Object name.
        readOnly: true
        x-nullable: false
      description:
        type: string
        x-nullable: true
        description: Object description.
```

## Steps to reproduce
swagger generate server --target ./ -name test --spec swagger.yaml --skip-flatten

## Environment
swagger version: 0.14.0  
go version: 1.10.2  
OS:   Linux
